intro: Euryomyrtus parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered myrtle, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of south-eastern Australia. It is a small shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, characterized by its aromatic, glossy leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes other well-known species such as eucalyptus and tea tree. Its flowers are usually clustered in dense inflorescences and are visited by various pollinators, including bees and birds. Euryomyrtus parviflora is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in heathland and coastal scrub environments.
